thread.title: Houghton Mifflin reports 2Q loss

title: Houghton Mifflin reports 2Q loss
text:
Houghton Mifflin reports 2Q loss Houghton Mifflin reports 2nd-quarter loss of $7.7 million 5 hours ago Content preferences Done 
BOSTON (AP) _ Houghton Mifflin Harcourt Co. (HMHC) on Thursday reported a second-quarter loss of $7.7 million, after reporting a profit in the same period a year earlier. 
On a per-share basis, the Boston-based company said it had a loss of 6 cents. Losses, adjusted to extinguish debt, came to 5 cents per share. 
The results missed Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of four analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 20 cents per share. 
The book publisher posted revenue of $379.9 million in the period. 
Houghton Mifflin shares have risen 26 percent since the beginning of the year. The stock has climbed 49 percent in the last 12 months.
